title: tips for noobs to climb elo
body:
1. Learn and play late game scaling champions like Nasus/Jax/Sion/Malphite/Vlad/Xerath/Orianna/Ryze/Cassiopedia 
2. Ask yourself why you died
3. Take into consideration the enemies items, cs, and powerspikes.  let's say the top lane maokai has died to you and he comes back to lane with a 200 mana item, boots, 4 potions, what does that tell us? He is going to fight us well over a longer duration, but he is susceptible to being 100-0ed...  another scenario (if the enemy lee sin is 30 cs ahead + 2 kills, and it's only the 8 min mark, he is against a Rammus and has itemized correctly, brutalizer, pickaxe, longsword, etc. you may conclude that within 1-2 rotations the enemy rammus will be dead) 

4. understanding the importance of cs, can't stress this enough, your #1 goal should be to get every possible cs (don't get cs if it means the enemy chunks you then kills you, etc) 

5. understanding the importance of wave positioning (enemy nasus is shoving his wave with e, trying to get the cs, this means Nasus denies himself q stacks, Nasus walks forward to q a minion, the enemy laner goes after him, best case scenario kills him, worst case scenario makes their jungler waste time/get chunked) 

6. work on your map awareness
7. react to enemy spells being down (you are a fed player, the only way the enemy yi can kill you 1v1 is if he dukes one of your key abilities with his q, you wait for him to waste it then go balls deep on him, he dies)

replies.body: At low levels people don't even check the scoreboard for items. Junglers don't know how to gank or help a losing lane. They don't know how to play defensive or even buy defensive items. If a solo laner gives up a few kills it will snowball. So pick early game champs if you are Wood level. Get out of bronze and then pick late game champs.

2 of these 3 champs are in the top bans list, and shouldn't be relied on for getting in ranked, the other is only good if your team can follow up and bring damage/you have a decent Yasuo (not likely in low elo.) on your team

Champs that are actually easy for low elo players that aren't on nearly everyones ban lists:

{{champion:1}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:50}} 

These champions are simple, have CC in some form (4 have AoE CC that isn't silence/slow) and if are behind in the game, can still be relevant for mid-late game.

I disagree whole heartedly with the first point. Lane bullies > Late scalers in Solo Que. People are more likely to rage quit or start yelling at "feeding" teammates and simply killing them over and over early can win you the psychological war.

Granted there are some exceptions. Like a late game Yi just dominates. I feel late game scalers require your team to not be feeders, which is only about 50% of the time. So it can work, don't get me wrong, I love playing a good Nasus, but when my bot lane is a combined 2-12 after 18 mins... kinda makes it extremely hard to carry when the botlane is swearing at each other, the jungler and spamming FF as soon as they can.

There are 3 things that will 100% get you out of bronze:

1. Farming. Farm properly, farm well.

2. AOE + CC. Amumu, Leona, Malphite, etc wreck face in low elo

3. Get objectives after kills, don't chase kills. Getting mid tower > chasing their mid laner half way across the map to finally kill them.

>Learn and play late game scaling champions like Nasus/Jax/Sion/Malphite/Vlad/Xerath/Orianna/Ryze/Cassiopedia

By time you've scaled into usefulness your team is 20v0 and the game is lost.

would you rather a bad player using champions like Lee, Xin, Lb, Riven and being unable to make use of an early advantage, or would you rather have them on something like Nasus/Jax/Yi which can always pose a threat? (provided it isn't a total stomp, like a 18/1/5 smurf, etc)

bad players should have a higher winrate if they learn these late game scaling champions as people in bronze can't close games and even if these late game champs get shut down, all they need is farm to come back into relevancy (particularly Nasus)

your giving players tips that don't help them close out games.

Fact is most bronze games you will have one good person that will roam and setup winning lanes from level 6, because snowballing people is better then doing fuck all and then wondering why you lose 50%

Fact is with late scaling champs, they only work in high elo, or in a team environment, because in both those cases you can trust people not to entirely feed.

Otherwise your sitting on a champ that has no relevance until 20 minutes and will have their team stomped into the ground by half decent players that pick early game snowballers.

In fact half these tips don't work until high elo anyway (hint: cs doesn't matter until at least high gold if you can get a kill in lane and snowball off it.)

Siv and his entire group are a massive showing off this, they suck at CSing, however they are all between gold-plat, why?

BECAUSE THEY PLAY EARLY GAME CHAMPS AND CAN SNOWBALL OFF KILLS.

Also your level 21 and giving tips on ranked, why?

These tips are worthless between bronze V to at least Gold III-I

if you watch high elo replays most games only go for ~25 mins because teams know how to close, the best strategy for low elo imo is to play champions that scale well but have the kit to also get early kills on bad players, like {{champion:55}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:24}}{{champion:34}}

>if you watch high elo replays most games only go for ~25 mins

Where the team comp isn't meant for late game.

Fact is it's still a shitty tip, and i would suggest not to pick jax as he is more reliant on a split pushing strategy in most low elo games over teamfighting.

Your aim is to in low elo be able to fight 1v2-3 and still be able to win the fight on your champ (Kat and swain are a yes, Anivia/Rumble are a no for most low elo players.)
